title: Chat input should be completely round with no text
body: At the moment, the default state of the chat input is to have a slight border radius but not quite 50%
Could I work on this issue?
Assigned you @staked-smart-ace
I am not sure about ```with no text``` in the issue subject. Could we make sure about this?
I think it just means that all times, it should have a circle border like here: https://www.figma.com/file/Mr3rqxxgKJ2zMQ06UAKiWL/%F0%9F%92%AC-Chat%E2%8E%9CDesktop?node-id=1919%3A23878
Unless it has multiple lines like here: https://www.figma.com/file/Mr3rqxxgKJ2zMQ06UAKiWL/%F0%9F%92%AC-Chat%E2%8E%9CDesktop?node-id=1920%3A378

According to design, border-radius is static 36px (not 50%).
What do you think about this?
That sounds right yeah

And then, the code was also implemented correctly with 36px,
I just checked code lines.

I think then it needs to be dynamic. If there is only one line of text, radius is 50% of the height.
if there are more than one line of text, then 36

![chat-input](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29419562/104613713-ee6fea00-56a0-11eb-85be-a60143657638.png)
This is showing in my local, it seems to be differentt with @PascalPrecht 's attachment
Could you also check yourself?

Hmm, that's very weird. On my Linux and Wndows machines, I have this 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11926403/104614594-649b2f00-5656-11eb-9c11-51eed285fa8f.png)

So somehow your screen is correct and ours are not. Maybe it's because of the resolution?
Are you on Mac?, I am in Win
I use Windows and a Linux VM and both have the incorrect borders
Since you can't reproduce, you can leave this issue for one of us and take another one in the meantime
let me try to do with dynamic radius

I need to check ```implicitHeight``` of the single line chat input box on your test env.
Could I add some debug code and commit so that you test it?

I'm not sure what you mean. You want to test if you code works well on my machine since you can't reproduce yourself?
We don't actually have a test env.

Since you said you work on Windows, you should know that for some unknown reason, `console.log`s in QML don't print in the console. It's one of the reasons why I code in a VM
The problem is that I can't reproduce this issue in my env
I am gonna show implicitHeight value as a placeholder text of chat input box.
Yeah, you can send your code so that we can test it, but if it doesn't work, it's probably better if one of us that can reproduce it fixes it, so that you can work on something else that you can test

Do you want me to make PR with temp code or send code snippet directly?
When you confirm correct value, I can just fix this issue :)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29419562/104643421-d8c0eb80-56c5-11eb-9605-adb440c22cc7.png)
This is code snippet.
Currently, it is showing ```40``` in my env
Now, I am expecting it will be 41~45 range
It is `41` on my env
Ok, let me fix this is right now :)
